title: Lebanon: Six months after a ceasefire with Israel, a low-intensity war is ongoing
summary: Since the November 27, 2024, ceasefire, Israel has continued to resort to violence in Lebanon. The Israeli army shelled the country's south on Thursday, fueling concerns about municipal elections set for Saturday.

title: Latest round of US-Iran nuclear talks ends in Rome
summary: Since returning to office, Trump has revived his 'maximum pressure' campaign on Iran, backing talks but warning of military action if diplomacy fails. Iran wants a new deal that would ease the sanctions, which have battered its economy.

title: A Paris court finds Kim Kardashian's robbers guilty, though none will serve time in prison
summary: The ringleader of the armed robbery, as well as seven other accomplices, were found guilty on Friday, but all walked out free. The chief judge conceded that the sentences 'aren't very severe' due in part to the defendants' ages. Two of the 10 defendants were acquitted.

title: South Africa rescues all 260 miners stuck underground alive
summary: The National Union of Mineworkers said the incident happened around 10:00 am (0800 GMT) on Thursday. It expressed concern for the miners who had been 'underground for almost 20 hours.'

title: How the rose sculpts its delicate corolla
summary: The concentration of mechanical forces at certain points on the growing petal explains the formation of the points, or 'cusps,' that are characteristic of the queen of flowers.

title: Louis Vuitton steps up its presence in the world of sports
summary: After sailing, tennis and rugby, the luxury brand is continuing its commitment to elite sports with Formula 1. Vuitton is building on its history with the automotive world and capitalizing on the growing public interest in this competition.

title: Trump signs executive orders to boost US nuclear energy
summary: President Trump announced on Friday that the focus would be on building smaller reactors, in addition to rolling back regulatory processes. The president denied that a fundamental overhaul of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission could compromise safety: 'It's time for nuclear and we're going to do it very big.'

title: Robert Kennedy Jr unveils his plan to 'Make America Healthy Again'
summary: The scientific community has not been reassured by the report, which discusses the number of mandatory vaccines and recommends more rigorous clinical trials.

title: Gaza: Many journalists' associations urge evacuation of Palestinian colleagues working for French outlets
summary: According to Brown University in the United States, the number of journalists killed in Gaza over the past 18 months exceeds the total number who died during both World Wars.

title: Tokyo lowers water bills during summer to encourage residents to use air conditioning during heat waves
summary: The Japanese capital has announced that this summer it will cover the fixed portion of residents' water bills to help them cope with increasingly intense summer heat, a consequence of climate change.

title: Republicans grant Trump political victory by passing his One Big Beautiful Bill Act in the House
summary: This sweeping bill, awaiting approval by the Senate, covers a wide range of spending, from tax policy to funding for mass deportations and funds allocated to the Pentagon. To get it passed, the US president put intense pressure on lawmakers in his own party.

title: Cannes 2025: Director Saeed Roustaee says, 'in Iran, all filmmakers are under surveillance'
summary: In competition with his new feature film, 'Woman and Child,' the Iranian filmmaker responds to accusations of compromising with the regime, in an interview with Le Monde.

title: Trump threatens 50% tariff on EU imports and targets smartphones
summary: Stock markets in Europe and the US plummeted on Friday after Donald Trump announced that trade talks were 'going nowhere' and spoke of 'a straight 50% Tariff on the European Union, starting on June 1.'

title: US judge suspends Trump administration's ban on Harvard enrolling foreign students
summary: The university has accused the US government, under President Donald Trump, of trying to 'control Harvard's governance, curriculum, and the 'ideology' of its faculty and students,' according to a lawsuit it filed.

title: Nuclear threat looms over conflict between India and Pakistan
summary: The use of nuclear weapons, possessed by both enemy states, casts a shadow over the recent conflict between India and Pakistan. While India's 'no first use' nuclear doctrine is well known, Pakistan's position remains much more ambiguous.

title: Harvard reeling after Trump administration ultimatum on foreign students
summary: The oldest and most prestigious university in the US has until Sunday to provide the documents required to regain its authorization to welcome foreign students. University leadership has condemned the move as 'unlawful.'

title: Germany: 12 people injured in knife attack at Hamburg train station
summary: According to the German daily newspaper 'Bild,' several injured people had life-threatening injuries. Hamburg police said the suspect had been apprehended.

title: Trial of child abuser Le Scouarnec: Prosecution seeks maximum sentence of 20 years' imprisonment
summary: Joël Le Scouarnec, 74, went on trial in February 2025 accused of 111 rapes and 189 sexual assaults at a dozen hospitals in western France.

title: 'What is a woman?': Court ruling reopens the 'gender war' in the UK
summary: By siding with 'gender critical' feminist activists critical of the notion of gender, the UK Supreme Court has reignited the debate over transgender women's rights. Trans rights activists are set to protest the decision in London on Sunday, May 25.

title: 'Sirens' on Netflix: A dark comedy with the feel of a crime thriller
summary: Despite a tone and atmosphere reminiscent of 'A Perfect Couple,' this new series about class conflict ultimately falls flat.

title: In Poland, parliament extends suspension of asylum rights at the Belarusian border
summary: The measure comes during the run-off period of the Polish presidential election, after a campaign dominated by the issue of migration.

title: In Gaza, the future erased
summary: The destruction of schools, universities, hospitals, factories and roads – Israel's conduct of its war in the Palestinian enclave aims to deprive residents of any prospects for the future, pushing them to abandon their land.

title: Massive Russian drone and missile strike hits Kyiv amid prisoner swap
summary: The attack came hours after Russia and Ukraine began a major prisoner exchange of hundreds of soldiers and civilians, the first phase of a swap agreed on by the two sides at a meeting in Istanbul last week.

title: Russia-Ukraine prisoner exchange: 'We all pray that they are among them'
summary: On Friday, Russia and Ukraine each handed over nearly 400 detainees. In Ukraine's Chernihiv border region, their relatives – especially wives – waited for them in anticipation.

title: Trump launches a new trade offensive against Europe
summary: On Friday, May 23, the US president threatened to impose 50% tariffs on European products. The 27 member states of the European Union, whose unity remains fragile, have not yet implemented any retaliatory measures.

title: Kim Kardashian robbery trial delivers measured verdict: 'You caused harm. You instilled fear. But the passage of time was taken into account'
summary: The Paris criminal court sentenced six defendants to prison terms ranging from four to eight years, all partially or fully suspended, meaning none will return to prison. The court acquitted the two men suspected of being the 'inside informants' for the robbers.

title: The United States's alarming budgetary drift
summary: Under pressure from Donald Trump, the House of Representatives passed a bill that brings together the president's main priorities. The legislation is expected to worsen living conditions for the poorest Americans, widen the deficit and inflate public debt.

title: Sabotage causes power outage at Cannes hours before Palme d'Or ceremony
summary: A suspected arson attack on electrical infrastructure plunged 160,000 homes into darkness and disrupted early events at the Cannes Film Festival.
